events.originalText: Megawati Sukarnoputri (pictured) became the first female president of Indonesia after her predecessor Abdurrahman Wahid was removed from office.
events.subtitle: Megawati Sukarnoputri
events.headline: Megawati Sukarnoputri becomes first female president of Indonesia

events.originalText: 47 people, mostly African American, were arrested in Tulia, Texas U.S., for dealing cocaine. Years later, 35 of the 47 were pardoned by the Governor.
events.subtitle: 1999 Tulia drug arrests
events.headline: 47 arrested in Tulia, Texas for dealing cocaine

events.originalText: Hale–Bopp (pictured), one of the most widely observed comets of the 20th century, was independently discovered by astronomers Alan Hale and Thomas Bopp.
events.subtitle: Comet Hale–Bopp
events.headline: Hale-Bopp comet discovered by astronomers Alan Hale and Thomas Bopp

events.originalText: Vanessa Williams, the first African-American Miss America, was forced to resign after the magazine Penthouse published nude photos of her without consent.
events.subtitle: Vanessa Williams
events.headline: Vanessa Williams forced to resign as Miss America over nude photos

events.originalText: A helicopter crashed during the filming of Twilight Zone: The Movie in Valencia, California, killing three people and leading to new safety standards.
events.subtitle: Twilight Zone accident
events.headline: Helicopter crash during filming of Twilight Zone: The Movie kills three

events.originalText: A shootout between police and a Black power group began in Cleveland, Ohio, sparking three days of rioting.
events.subtitle: Glenville shootout
events.headline: Shootout in Cleveland sparks three days of rioting

events.originalText: The Holocaust: The gas chambers at Treblinka extermination camp began operation, killing 6,500 Jews who had been transported from the Warsaw Ghetto the day before.
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: Gas chambers at Treblinka extermination camp begin operation

events.originalText: Sumner Welles, U.S. Under Secretary of State, issued a declaration that the U.S. government would not recognize the Soviet Union's annexation of the Baltic states.
events.subtitle: Sumner Welles
events.headline: U.S. government refuses to recognize Soviet Union's annexation of Baltic states

events.originalText: Wilfred Rhodes of England and Yorkshire became the only person to play in 1,000 first-class cricket matches.
events.subtitle: Wilfred Rhodes
events.headline: Wilfred Rhodes plays in 1,000 first-class cricket matches

events.originalText: The first National Congress of the Chinese Communist Party opened in a house in Shanghai.
events.subtitle: 1st National Congress of the Chinese Communist Party
events.headline: First National Congress of Chinese Communist Party opens in Shanghai

events.originalText: Austria-Hungary presented Serbia with an ultimatum to allow them to investigate the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand, which Serbia ultimately rejected, leading to World War I.
events.subtitle: Austria-Hungary
events.headline: Austria-Hungary ultimatum to Serbia leads to World War I

events.originalText: During a visit of the French Navy to Kronstadt in Russia, the two nations reached a secret agreement on a joint response to any future war in Europe.
events.subtitle: Kronstadt–Toulon naval visits
events.headline: France and Russia reach secret agreement during French Navy visit to Kronstadt

events.originalText: American Civil War: Henry Halleck was appointed general-in-chief of the Union Army.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Henry Halleck appointed general-in-chief of Union Army

events.originalText: The trial of the Eastbourne manslaughter, which later became an important legal precedent in the United Kingdom for discussions of corporal punishment in schools, began in Lewes.
events.subtitle: Eastbourne manslaughter
events.headline: Trial of Eastbourne manslaughter begins in Lewes

events.originalText: William Austin Burt was awarded a patent for the typographer, the first practical typewriting machine.
events.subtitle: William Austin Burt
events.headline: William Austin Burt awarded patent for typographer machine

events.originalText: A fleet led by the Knights Hospitaller sank 22 of 28 ships of the Turkish Aydinid emirate.
events.subtitle: Knights Hospitaller
events.headline: Knights Hospitaller fleet sinks 22 Turkish ships
